publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary:
I) Daily Office Prayers and Litanies (fols. 1ra-19va) II) Śǝrʿatä qǝddase “Ordinary of the Mass” (fols. 19va-49va) III) Anaphoras (fols. 49va-131vb) III-1) Anaphora of the Apostles (fols. 49va-61vc) III-2) Anaphora of Our Lord Jesus Christ (fols. 62va-65rc), preceded by “The Testament of the Lord” (fol. 62ra-va) III-3) Anaphora of Our Lady by St. Cyriacus of Behnesa (fols. 65va-74vc) III-4) Anaphora of St. John, son of Thunder (fols. 74va-82rc) III-5) Anaphora of the 318 Orthodox Fathers of Nicaea (fols. 82rc-88vc) III-6) Anaphora of St. Athanasius of Alexandria (fols. 89ra-97vc) III-7) Anaphora of St. Basil of Caesarea (fols. 97va-104rc) III-8) Anaphora of St. Gregory (“Hosanna-liturgy” of St. Gregory) (fols. 104va-109rc) III-9) Anaphora of St. Jacob of Serug (fols. 109ra-113vc) III-10) Anaphora of St. John Chrysostom (fols. 114ra-118rb) III-11) Anaphora of St. Dioscorus of Alexandria (fols. 118rb-119vb) III-12) Anaphora of St. Epiphanius of Cyprus (fols. 119vc-125rb) III-13) Anaphora of St. Cyril of Alexandria (fols. 125rb-129va) III-14) Second Anaphora of St. Gregory (“Christmas-liturgy” of St. Gregory) (fols. 129va-131vb) IV) Prayer to the Cross (fols. 131vb-132rb)
Additio 1.

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 132.0 folios, of which blank 132v, in 14.0 quires .
27.5 21.0 7.8
supportDesc.condition: Some leaves are heavily stained with dirt or rumpled. The lower inner edges of fols. 31 and 32 have been mended with patches of parchment sewn on to them.

layout.ab: Primary pricks are mostly visible (s. fol. 80r).
Ruling pricks are mostly visible (s. fol. 70r).
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

decoDesc.decoNote:
Nomina sacra; first words (headings or parts of headings) of constituent texts; directives for the ministers; word ʾǝgäle in supplication formulas; some interlineal musical signs; most of the abbreviations; elements of the punctuation signs and Ethiopic numerals.
The incipit parts of most of the constituent texts are written alternately in red and black lines (e. g., fols. 1ra-rc, 49va-vc, 62ra-rc).
- f. 1r: Wide coloured (red, blue, black) ornamental band over the incipit of text I, with geometric and floral ornamentation motifs.
- f. 49ra: Narrow coloured (red, blue, black) ornamental band over the incipit of text III-1, with geometric ornamentation motifs and four ails at the corners.
- f. 62r: Wide coloured (red, blue, black) ornamental band over the incipit of text III-2, with geometric ornamentation motifs and four ails at the corners.
- f. 119vc: Narrow black ornamental band over the incipit of text III-12, crudely drawn.

list.item: f. 132rc: Donation note.f. 132rc: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ ዘሹም፡ አጋሜ፡ ካሳ፡ ዘወሀቦ፡ ለመድኃኔ፡ ዓለም፡ አድግራት፡ ወስመ፡ ጥምቀቱ፡ ወልደ፡ አረጋዊ፡ ከመ፡ ይኩኖ፡ መርሀ፡ ለመንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት። ዘሠረቆ፡ ወዘፈሐቆ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ለይኩን፡ በሥልጣነ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡ ወበቃለ፡ መምሕርነ፡ ኪዳነ፡ ማርያም። f. 132rc: This is a book of šum ʾAgame Kasa whose baptismal name is Walda ʾAragāwi, who has donated it to the (church of) Madḫāne ʿĀlam ʾAddǝgrat so that it might be for him a guide to the Kingdom of Heaven. He who stole it or erased (its text) shall be excommunicated by the authority of Peter and Paul and by the word of our mamhǝr Kidanä Māryām. he note is written in the main hand. Šum ʾAgame Kasa (a son of ras Sǝbḥat) is also mentioned in Additiones to Mss. AMM-008, AMQ-011, BGY-006, MKL-005, MKL-006. He was governor of ʾAgame in 1914-18, 1941-48. Cp. HAGOS GEBRE YOHANNES, “Political History of Tigray: Rivalry for power (1910-1935)”, PhD thesis, Addis Abäba University, 2003, 46.

- The title of the work, ቅዳሤ፡, has been crudely inscribed in green ink on the front cover. - Tamallas-signs, in the shape of two perpendicular lines, indicating the place where the omissions written in the margins, in the main hand, belong: fols. 3vb l.2, 4rc l.15, 8rb l.9, 13va l.11, 41rc l.15, 42va l.19, 66ra l.4, 70rc l.12, 84vc l.2, 86va l.16, 95vc l.1, 102ra l.12, 104vb l.20, 105vc l.12, 112ra l.2, 114vc l.15, 117va l.13, 119va l.10, 126ra l.12. - Omitted words and passages are written in interlineally or in the margins, in the main and in a secondary hands: fols. 15vc, 30rc, 53r, 108r, 109vb, 110vc, 114ra, 128v, 131r. - Crude recent notes indicating liturgical occasions upon which the respective Anaphoras are to be celebrated: fols. 90r, 107r, 119v (in the upper margin). - Crude notes, partly in red and pink ink: fols. 99r, 109r, 111r, 116v, 122v, 123r, 124v (in the upper margin). - f. 124v (in the left-hand margin): Crude notes.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with light brown tooled leather, textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.
Blind tooled ornament on the light brown leather cover (at least 4 tools were used: triple line fillet, triple sine wave, criss-cross, x-form).

origin.origDate: Additio 1 mentions šum ʾAgame Kasa as the donor of the Ms. Šum ʾAgame Kasa was governor of ʾAgame in 1914-18, 1941-48. The absence of the name of the reigning monarch in the Ms. suggests that it was written during the earlier of the two terms of office.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: According to Additio 1, the Ms. was donated by šum ʾAgame Kasa, whose baptismal name is Walda ʾAragāwi.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
